abstract: Nonprofit developer Phipps Houses, which runs Lambert Houses in Bronx, says they will demolish development and replace it with taller towers containing twice as many apartments;  Vicki L Been, commissioner of Dept of Housing Preservation and Development, says project will make better use of 12-acre site and provide opportunity to update design of the buildings.

keywords.value: Department of Housing Preservation and Development (NYC)
keywords.name: organizations

lead_paragraph: The Lambert Houses complex was celebrated when it opened in the mid-1970s, but now its owner considers it outdated and poorly designed. A $600 million plan will try to change that.
snippet: The Lambert Houses complex was celebrated when it opened in the mid-1970s, but now its owner considers it outdated and poorly designed. A $600 million plan will try to change that....

headline.main: Rebirth of Bronx Housing Complex Aims to Cut Crime and Increase Homes
headline.print_headline: Rebirth of a Bronx Housing Complex Aims to Cut Crime and Increase Homes
